person.persName: Hartwell T. Burge (Muhlenberg, Kentucky, chaplain and colonel)

body.p: Muhlenberg County, Kentucky, chaplain and soldier. Virginia native. Married to Mary Jane Hartwell. Father of A. C. Burge, Phebe T. Burge, S. A. Burge, Martha Burge, Mary F. Burge, Daniel Burge, and Virginia Burge. Methodist minister in Adair County in 1850. Methodist minister in Muhlenberg County in 1860. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) as chaplain from December 13, 1861 to June 23, 1863. Served in the 48th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as colonel from October 15, 1863 to December 19, 1864. Commanded Post of Bowling Green, Kentucky, District of Kentucky, Department of the Ohio, from January 1864 to March 1864. Commanded Post of Munfordville, Kentucky, District of Kentucky, Department of the Ohio, from April 1864 to August 1864.
